titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rockefeller Foundation records, projects, SG 1.37 (A2012) FA472

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 16:26:30 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Foundation records, projects, SG 1.37 (A2012)

physdesc.extent: 49 record storage boxes, 1 letter document box, and 1 oversize box

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Project files transferred to the RAC by Rockefeller Foundation, 2012.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Records are primarily arranged by Program, with some materials arranged by the RF traditional series numbers.
Records are arranged as received. Within folders, materials are primarily arranged in reverse chronological order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist. RAC is unable to provide access to obsolete media and original digital media. In addition separated media may not yet have undergone stabilization procedures. When feasible, a digital surrogate may be created via special order. All applicable charges will apply.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Records have received basic level 1 processing to establish initial intellectual and physical control of the holdings. Materials remain in original record cartons and folders.
This guide provides file level description. Each file may represent multiple folders.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Special Formats (audio, film, video, digital media, library materials, memorabilia, oversize, and photographic material) have been separated from the body of the collection. All pertinent items are assigned a unique separation number, as noted. Requests to access open special formats should reference the unique separation number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Grant administration files and related materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Rockefeller Foundation has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them. Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.
